Description: Blue glazed composition scarab, elytra marked, pierced longitudinally, base decorated with a representation of a seated dog.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: This scarab could be a product of the Scarab Factory (on the production see Gorton 1996, 91-131). Gorton, A.F. 1996, Egyptian and Egyptianizing scarabs: a typology of steatite, faience, and paste scarabs from Punic and other Mediterranean sites, Oxford.
